I feel like we should just delete this and OrigForkChoiceStrategy now.  We only use this as part of the fork choice reference tests - the original idea for keeping it around was to compare results with the protoarray fork choice but the reference tests are a better way to confirm it's behaviour is right.
Doesn't need to be in this PR though.
There will have to be another PR for cleaning up the Fork Choice Reference Tests anyway in the near future, so this can be left for that PR.

We need to hold the protoArrayLock readLock here so that it's safe to access protoArray.  Given that justifiedCheckpoint is only updated in updateForkChoiceWeights which holds the protoArray write lock that will also make the access to justifiedCheckpoint safe.  Probably should add a comment that justifiedCheckpoint is guarded by protoArrayLock as it might not be obvious.
forkChoiceState has its own locks and the variable in Store is final so we don't need to hold the read lock here.
We don't need the read lock here either.

There's a bit of a clash going on here - every other method in Store.Transaction has no effect on the underlying Store until commit is called, except this one.
updateHead probably shouldn't be on Store.Transaction at all as the transaction is always immediately committed and no other changes are made to the store, so it probably should just be a method directly on UpdatableStore.
Yeah - I was thinking that we were only updating votes here, but that's not the case.  I ended up creating an Updater object to handle forkChoice updates - have a look here: fb0cc2f
Yep that makes sense to me.  Looks good.

This ones slightly interesting - I was expecting that it would wind up making changes to forkChoice immediately, but it actually only changes votes which are stored in Store and so no changes are applied until commit is called.  So it all works as long as forkChoiceState.onAttestation isn't changed in the future to change things other than votes.
